events.originalText: The Norwegian Progress Party was founded in a movie theater in Oslo.
events.subtitle: Progress Party (Norway)
events.headline: Norwegian Progress Party founded in Oslo movie theater

events.originalText: BOAC Flight 712 experienced an engine fire shortly after take-off from London Heathrow, leading to the deaths of five people on board, including flight attendant Jane Harrison, who was posthumously awarded a George Cross for heroism.
events.subtitle: BOAC Flight 712
events.headline: BOAC Flight 712 engine fire kills five, including Jane Harrison

events.originalText: A large explosion on board the MV Dara in the Persian Gulf killed 238 people.
events.subtitle: MV Dara
events.headline: Explosion on MV Dara in Persian Gulf kills 238

events.originalText: A team of computer scientists and others met to discuss the creation of a common business-oriented programming language that became COBOL.
events.subtitle: Computer science
events.headline: Computer scientists discuss creation of COBOL language

events.originalText: Otto and Elise Hampel were executed in Berlin for performing acts of resistance against Nazism.
events.subtitle: Otto and Elise Hampel
events.headline: Otto and Elise Hampel executed in Berlin for resistance acts

events.originalText: World War II: The United States Army Air Forces flew its first mission from India over the Hump (the eastern end of the Himalayas) to deliver materiel to China.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US Army Air Forces fly first mission over the Hump to China

events.originalText: The Australian state of Western Australia voted to secede from the federation, but efforts to implement the result proved to be unsuccessful.
events.subtitle: Western Australia
events.headline: Western Australia votes to secede from federation

events.originalText: American cartoonist Winsor McCay released the silent short film Little Nemo (featured), one of the earliest animated films.
events.subtitle: Winsor McCay
events.headline: Winsor McCay releases silent film Little Nemo

events.originalText: Longacre Square in Midtown Manhattan, was renamed Times Square after the New York Times building.
events.subtitle: Midtown Manhattan
events.headline: Longacre Square renamed Times Square in Manhattan

events.originalText: France and the United Kingdom signed the Entente Cordiale, agreeing to a peaceful coexistence after centuries of intermittent conflict.
events.subtitle: Entente Cordiale
events.headline: France and UK sign Entente Cordiale for peaceful coexistence

events.originalText: American Civil War: Late-arriving reinforcements helped Confederate forces rout the Union Army at the Battle of Mansfield.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Confederate forces rout Union Army at Battle of Mansfield

events.originalText: A Greek peasant discovered a statue of a woman with its arms missing—the Venus de Milo—on the Aegean island of Milos.
events.subtitle: Venus de Milo
events.headline: Greek peasant discovers Venus de Milo statue on Milos island

events.originalText: Kiliaen van Rensselaer purchased land near present-day Albany, New York, to found the Manor of Rensselaerswyck, which became the most successful patroonship under the Dutch West India Company.
events.subtitle: Kiliaen van Rensselaer (merchant)
events.headline: Kiliaen van Rensselaer founds Manor of Rensselaerswyck near Albany

events.originalText: Crusades: The Knights Hospitaller surrendered the Krak des Chevaliers, a castle in present-day Syria, to the army of the Mamluk sultan Baibars.
events.subtitle: Crusades
events.headline: Knights Hospitaller surrender Krak des Chevaliers to Mamluk army

events.originalText: Abbasid forces decisively defeated those of Saffarid emir Ya'qub ibn Laith, forcing the latter to halt his advance into Iraq.
events.subtitle: Abbasid Caliphate
events.headline: Abbasid forces defeat Saffarid emir Ya'qub ibn Laith in Iraq

events.originalText: Roman emperor Caracalla (pictured) was assassinated near Harran and succeeded by his Praetorian Guard prefect Macrinus.
events.subtitle: Caracalla
events.headline: Roman emperor Caracalla assassinated near Harran
